comment.author: 37714589@N07
comment._content:
This could well be Tom Sullivan, professional sculler/oarsman in the 1890's. One time Professional Sculling Championship of England and challenger for the Professional Sculling Championship of the World.

He (if this is the same person) was born in 1868, Auckland, New Zealand. So in 1910 for example he would have been 48. This probably fits the age of the Tom Sullivan in the picture.

By 1910 Sullivan was a very successful rowing coach. Coaching mainly in Germany before WW1 until his death.

Would the LOC collection be more likely to include sports 'stars' than attorneys? (I hope so).

I have a younger photo of the rowing Tom Sullivan and it looks remarkably similar.

Happy to provide more information on him.

comment.author: 34997905@N03
comment._content:
Thanks, mgracee. We will investigate and possibly add a note to the catalog record based on your identification.

BTW, regarding your question of what types of personages the LoC is most likely to collect: in this case, it really depends on what George Grantham Bain considered newsworthy in 1910s New York.

Thanks again!

comment.author: 86036071@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sullivan's United, and we'd love to have this added to the group! Welcome to - The Sullivan Clan!! Thank you for sharing with your photo's with us.... Sullivans
